titleStmt.title: St. Paules-Church her bill for the Parliament as it was presented to the Kings Matie on Midlent-Sunday last, and intended for the view of that most high and honorable court, and generally for all such as beare good will to the reflourishing estate of the said church. Partly in verse, partly in prose. Penned and published for her good by Hen: Farley author of her complaint.
titleStmt.author: Farley, Henry.

titleStmt.title: St. Paules-Church her bill for the Parliament as it was presented to the Kings Matie on Midlent-Sunday last, and intended for the view of that most high and honorable court, and generally for all such as beare good will to the reflourishing estate of the said church. Partly in verse, partly in prose. Penned and published for her good by Hen: Farley author of her complaint.
titleStmt.author: Farley, Henry.

notesStmt.note: In verse and prose. Advocating and celebrating the repair of St. Paul's Cathedral.
Printer's and publisher's names from STC.
The title page and F1 verso each have a woodcut of St. Paul's with different verses in the scrolls. This woodcut is also found in STC 10688.5, where it has yet different verses in the scrolls--STC.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
